article.title: Intrinsic linking with linking numbers of specified divisibility

multiple_choice_question.text:
The formula  
  
  `Dab = Ui=a Δi`  
  
is used to define:
choices: The linking number between two components of a link.
The number of vertices in a path of length l.
A path of length l in a triangulated disc.
The connect sum of two n-spheres.

multiple_choice_question.text:
The inequality 
  
  `N > κn(D, r) = 4r²(2n + 4) + ση(D, 4r²) ` 
  
provides a sufficient condition for:
choices: The existence of a knot with a second Conway coefficient divisible by q.
The existence of a generalized key ring with r keys where the ring contains two disjoint copies of a triangulated disc D.
The number of vertices needed in a complete n-complex to guarantee a two component link with linking number divisible by q.
The minimal number of vertices required for a triangulated sphere to contain two oppositely oriented copies of a triangulated disc D and m additional n-simplices.
The linking number between two specific components of links J and L.
The linking pattern of a link L.
A matrix containing the linking numbers between all pairs of components from two disjoint links J and L.
The mod 2 linking pattern of a link J.

multiple_choice_question.text: The main purpose of Lemma 3.2 is to:
choices: Establish the existence of D-large n-spheres.
Prove that intrinsic linking of complete graphs is arbitrarily complex.
Find a sublink with specific divisibility properties for its linking number sums.
Define the structure of a generalized key ring.
